results.title: The Phantom of the opera (1925)
results.creator_credit: Rupert Julian, Carl Laemmle and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: The cinema classic features the legendary Lon Chaney in one of his finest performances. The famed unmasking sequence is still powerful after all these years, and the final scene of the Phantom restraining the mobs of Paris to protect his true love will linger in the memory. Colour-tinted version with music accompaniment provided by the City of Prague Philharmonic.

results.title: A Taxing woman
results.creator_credit: Juzo Itami, Seigo Hosogoe and Yasushi Tamaoki
results.brief_description: Evading taxes is a popular pastime in “The Land of the Rising Yen”, especially among the predatory real estate tycoons who, in collusion with politicians, gangsters and large “straight” business combines, have made Japan’s land prices the highest in the world. To combat this pandemic “lawlessness” there is a national tax police, who, with their almost storm trooper tactics, make America’s much maligned IRS inspectors seem almost helpful. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Going Down
results.brief_description: A searing vision of a Sydney rarely seen by tourists but one that is just below the surface. A cult hit in the past, this film has been described by Philip Adams as one of the ten best made in this country. It is the story of four young women on the town the night before one of them is travelling to New York. Their adolescence, their group, their future is breaking up. Starring Tracy Mann and David Argue.

results.title: The Coca-Cola Kid
results.creator_credit: Dusan Makavejev, David Roe and Sylvie Le Clezio
results.brief_description: Droll, sometimes wacky comedy in which an American representative from the multi-national soft-drink company of the title heads for Australia to establish his company’s product as the beverage of choice and along the way ends up finding the road to success filled with obstacles that include a passionate romance. Stars Greta Scacchi and Eric Roberts. Cinematography by Dean Semler. Based on the Frank Moorhouse novel. Rated: M

results.title: Tampopo
results.creator_credit: Seigo Hosogoe, Yasushi Tamaoki, Juzo Itami, New Century and Itami Productions
results.brief_description: Hilarious Japanese comedy about two truckdrivers, Goro (a noodle connoisseur) and Gun, who stop at a non-de-script noodle restaurant where they encounter its proprietor, Tampopo, and her bullying admirer Pisken. Goro is beaten up by Pisken and his associates and he awakens on the floor of Tampopo’s restaurant. She asks him to help her save her restaurant and so the search for the perfect noodle is begun, with the help of an odd assortment of characters, food, wine and a touch of sex.

results.title: Melo
results.brief_description: Pierre and Maniche are happily married until she meets Marcel, Pierre’s friend. Romaine and Marcel have an affair which ends tragically. Pierre remarries and before leaving the country he visits Marcel to learn the truth about Romaine. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Overlanders
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Sir Michael Balcon, Ralph Smart and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: Although superficially comparable with cattle drive Westerns like Red River, the emphasis in this film is on the cooperative nature of the enterprise - a cattle drive from Northern Australia in 1942 to escape the Japanese - rather than on notions of individualism at the centre of the western ethos. Starring Chips Rafferty, The Overlanders is a documentary in spirit, recreating the hazards of an epic drive and carefully assembling the mannerisms, vocabulary and attitudes to characterize the Australian bushman. There was also a strong role for a woman - Daphne Campbell as Mary Parsons - carrying on the tradition of the bush heroine established in Australian films of the twenties and thirties. Based on an actual cattle drive of 1942 organised by the government of Northern Australia to remove supplies from the reach of the Japanese. Cast also includes John Nugent Hayward.

results.title: Le Choix des Armes
results.brief_description: The high walls of a prison. Two running shadows in the night, a parked Volvo car whose engine is running. Suddenly, the shrieking sound of an alarm hooter. Both men get hastily inside the car which starts immediately. A well directed drama about a retired gangster (Yves Montand) forced into an antagonistic relationship with a young punk. (Gerard Depardieu).

results.title: Ground Zero
results.brief_description: Harvey Denton (Colin Friels) is movie cameraman who is plunged into a bewildering series of events when, one night, his flat is viciously ransacked. Someone is after something, but what? Now Trebilcock of ASIO, Australia’s secret service, contacts Harvey with strange news. The body of his father, a documentary filmmaker, missing since Harvey was a boy, has been found in the desert outback, buried inside a thirty year old plane wreck and the wreck is discovered to be radioactive.

results.title: Heatwave
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Ross Matthews, Hilary Linstead and Heatwave Films Pty Ltd, Sydney Australia F F P A A
results.brief_description: A suspenseful thriller about a woman who cared too much about people, their lives and their homes, and a man who had a job to do and wouldn’t be swayed by emotions. She represented the people, he represented power and corruption and together they were heading towards trouble. Cast includes Judy Davis, Richard Moir, Chris Haywood, Bill Hunter and John Meillon. PLEASE NOTE: THE 16MM PRINT OF THIS FILM HAS NORWEGIAN SUBTITLES
